plant_concentrations.References: (1) Cox PA et al; Proc Natl Acad Sci 100: 13380-3 (2003). Available from, as of Jun 25, 2012: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC263822/ (2) Cox PA et al; Proc Natl Acad Sci 102: 5074-8 (2005). Available from, as of Jun 25, 2012: https://www.pnas.org/content/102/14/5074.full.pdf+html
plant_concentrations.Value: 3-(Methylamino)-(DL)-alanine was found in Cycas micronesica fleshy seed sarcotesta at an average of 9 ug/g(1), in the outermost seed layer at 1161 ug/g(1) and in the coralloid roots at 37 ug/g(2).

animal_concentrations.References: (1) Cox PA et al; Proc Nation Acad Sci 100:13380-3 (2003). Available from, as of Jun 25, 2012: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC263822/
animal_concentrations.Value: 3-(Methylamino)-(DL)-alanine was detected in flying foxes (Pteropus mariannus) at a mean concentration of 3556 ug/g(1).

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) Brand LE et al; Nat Inst Health 9: 620-35 (2010). Available from, as of Jun 25, 2012: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2968748/
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: Concentrations of 3-(methylamino)-(DL)-alanine(BMAA) were reported in sea life from Florida waters(1).
